    • Method Detail

      • getFileResource

        public String getFileResource(String name)
        This method will give you back the filename incl. the absolute path name to the resource. If the resource does not exist it will give you back the resource name incl. the path. It will give you back an absolute path incl. the name which is in the same directory as the the class you've called it from.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

      • getMavenBaseDir

        public String getMavenBaseDir()
        Return the base directory of the project. This works under Maven on command line and within Eclipse as well.
        Returns:
        The path with is defined by basedir.

      • getTargetDir

        public String getTargetDir()
        Return the target folder of the current project.
        Returns:
        The target folder.

      • getSrcDirectory

        public String getSrcDirectory()
        This will return the src folder.
        Returns:
        The src folder of the project.

      • getTestDirectory

        public String getTestDirectory()
        This will return the src/test folder.
        Returns:
        The src/test folder.

      • getTestResourcesDirectory

        public String getTestResourcesDirectory()
        This will return the src/test/resources folder of the project.
        Returns:
        The src/test/resources folder.
